info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 26 at 11:54PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A THUNDERSTORM WITH INTENSE LIGHTNING WILL IMPACT FRANKLIN AND HART COUNTIES UNTIL 1245 AM EDT... At 1154 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a thunderstorm with intense lightning 9 miles east of Carnesville, or near Lavonia, moving south at 10 mph. Locations to be impacted include... Hartwell, Carnesville, Royston, Lavonia, Gumlog, Canon, Franklin Springs, Bowersville, Victoria Bryant State Park and Martin. In addition to intense lightning, very heavy rainfall rates up to 2 inches per hour will be possible in these areas.
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall may flood areas with poor drainage, such as ditches and underpasses. Avoid these areas and do not cross flooded roads. Water levels of small streams may also rise rapidly. Seek higher ground if threatened by flood waters. Frequent lightning is occurring with this storm. If outdoors, try to get indoors or into a hard topped vehicle. Otherwise, stay away from open areas and isolated high objects such as trees. When indoors, stay away from windows and doors and avoid using wired electronic devices. Do not take a shower or bath. Try to unplug unnecessary appliances before the storm approaches.
